channel.title: Omg please help me!
channel.description: Okay, I'm getting mad. I know it has SOMETHING to do with my ports. I have made my server and everything, I can join, but my friends can't. It's l33xpshit.no-ip.biz . Please don't give me any crap to a tutorial on how to forward my ports... I'VE READ IT ALREADY! I went through 9 Google pages worth of tutorials and still nothing. Tell me whats wrong.. here's a pic of my ports and shit.

item.title: Omg please help me!
item.dc:creator: @Lazer23 Lazer23
item.description:
@Lazer23 wrote:

Did so. Still not working.

Read full topic

item.description:

Make sure you have only 1 runserver batch file on…

item.title: Omg please help me!
item.dc:creator: @Lazer23 Lazer23
item.description:
@Lazer23 wrote:

I can log into it, but nobody else can, that’s why I figured it’s my ports. It’s obviously not, cause everytime I go to run my server it says that the port is already in use. NO! I am not running two servers at once, something is just fucked up

Read full topic

item.title: Omg please help me!
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

What do you mean it’s not working?

Read full topic

item.title: Omg please help me!
item.dc:creator: @Lazer23 Lazer23
item.description:
@Lazer23 wrote:

No… I’m running my Server Compile, then from there I hit Runserver. Does that have anything to do with it? Cause… it’s still not working :S

Read full topic

item.title: Omg please help me!
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

The runserver batch file just runs your server. Do not worry about the 0.0.0.0. Your port is 54794 in that case. Your IP is either your hamachi IP or the IP that you made in the no-ip site.

Read full topic

item.title: Omg please help me!
item.dc:creator: @Lazer23 Lazer23
item.description:
@Lazer23 wrote:

Alright. Thanks, I did that. I’m still having a problem. When I run my server it just automatically goes to IP 0.0.0.0 port 54794… how can I make it connect through my IP?

Read full topic

item.title: Omg please help me!
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

Make the “start” and “end” box the same. So if your port is 5555, put 5555 in the “start” and “end” box. And you also need to go to Control Panel and add a port exception to your windows firewall.

Read full topic
